Class ChaiCrFactory

Factory for generating Challenges, ChallengeSets and ResponseSets.

Jason D. Rivard

Method Detail

newChaiResponseSet

public static ChaiResponseSet newChaiResponseSet(Map<Challenge,String> challengeResponseMap,
                                                 Locale locale,
                                                 int minimumRandomRequired,
                                                 ChaiConfiguration chaiConfiguration,
                                                 String csIdentifier)
                                          throws ChaiValidationException
Create a new ResponseSet. The generated ResponseSet will be suitable for writing to the directory.

Parameters:
challengeResponseMap - A map containing Challenges as the key, and string responses for values
locale - The locale the response set is stored in
minimumRandomRequired - Minimum random responses required
Returns:
A ResponseSet suitable for writing.
Throws:
ChaiValidationException - when there is a logical problem with the response set data, such as more randoms required then exist

public static boolean writeChaiResponseSet(ChaiResponseSet chaiResponseSet,
                                           ChaiUser chaiUser)
                                    throws ChaiUnavailableException,
                                           ChaiOperationException
Throws:

ChaiOperationException

readChaiResponseSet

public static ChaiResponseSet readChaiResponseSet(ChaiUser user)
                                           throws ChaiUnavailableException,
                                                  ChaiValidationException,
                                                  ChaiOperationException
Read the user's configured ResponseSet from the directory.

A caller would typically use the returned ResponseSet for testing responses by calling the ResponseSet's ResponseSet#test(java.util.Map) method.

Parameters:
user - ChaiUser to read responses for
Returns:
A valid ResponseSet if found, otherwise null.
Throws:
ChaiUnavailableException - If the directory server(s) are unavailable
ChaiValidationException - when there is a logical problem with the response set data, such as more randoms required then exist
ChaiOperationException

parseChaiResponseSetXML

                                           throws ChaiValidationException,
                                                  ChaiOperationException

ChaiValidationException
ChaiOperationException
